revised_title: An Analysis of British and Foreign Salt Varieties: Their Chemical Composition and Fitness for Economical Purposes
tldr: Dr. Henry conducted a comprehensive analysis of various British and foreign salt varieties to determine their chemical composition and suitability for different purposes. He found that Cheshire salt is generally purer than foreign bay-salt and that the differences in properties among salt varieties are mainly due to their mechanical properties, such as crystal size and compactness, rather than their chemical composition.
